alert.note: Alert for Marion; Morrow (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 12:17PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marion and northwestern Morrow Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waldo, or 7 miles south of Marion, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Mount Gilead, Prospect, Waldo, Caledonia, Edison, Green Camp and State Route 229 at US Route 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
